head.title: Nanny Pleads Not Guilty In Death of an Infant

hedline.hl1: Nanny Pleads Not Guilty In Death of an Infant

abstract.p: Louise Woodward, nanny, pleads not guilty to murder charges in Newton, Mass, death of infant Matthew Eappen (S)

block.p: A British nanny who worked for a Massachusetts couple pleaded not guilty on Friday to first-degree murder charges here in the death of a 9-month boy in her care last month.

An autopsy showed that the infant, Matthew Eappen of Newton, Mass., had died of a two-inch fracture to the back of his head, probably caused by being thrown or struck. Prosecutors also say the nanny, Louise Woodward, had shaken the baby until his brain hemorrhaged.
A British nanny who worked for a Massachusetts couple pleaded not guilty on Friday to first-degree murder charges here in the death of a 9-month boy in her care last month.

An autopsy showed that the infant, Matthew Eappen of Newton, Mass., had died of a two-inch fracture to the back of his head, probably caused by being thrown or struck. Prosecutors also say the nanny, Louise Woodward, had shaken the baby until his brain hemorrhaged.
Ms. Woodward, who turned 19 last week, pleaded not guilty to assault charges in February. Prosecutors added the murder charge after Matthew died on Feb. 9.

Ms. Woodward arrived in the Boston area last July to work for EF Au Pair, a nanny-placement agency in Cambridge. She has been held without bail at the maximum security Framingham prison since her arrest on Feb. 5.
